body_html:
Dask requirements list pandas >= 0.16.0.

When using pip or a requirements.txt file is it possible that you're just installing dask rather than dask[dataframe] or dask[complete]? Depending on dask[dataframe] should properly enforce installation of newer NumPy/Pandas libraries.
body_text:
Dask requirements list pandas >= 0.16.0.
When using pip or a requirements.txt file is it possible that you're just installing dask rather than dask[dataframe] or dask[complete]?  Depending on dask[dataframe] should properly enforce installation of newer NumPy/Pandas libraries.
body:
Dask requirements list `pandas >= 0.16.0`.  

When using `pip` or a `requirements.txt` file is it possible that you're just installing `dask` rather than `dask[dataframe]` or `dask[complete]`?  Depending on `dask[dataframe]` should properly enforce installation of newer NumPy/Pandas libraries.
